fields.description:
Unit tests for each part.
 * POC will support CI/CD into workflow. Ideally each story/task/bug is a git tag, where CI/CD tests get run and mark pull requests.  Terminology may need revision here. A Pull request is a kind of tag.  Probably easier to test and find out.

 * At around 75% complete project should deploy itself to cloud to run basic services and unit tests.  There are a lot of parts to get to this point.        CI/ Workflow, when code is committed, CI tests are run, if passing 100% code is deployed.
 * Code roadmaps tied to Git tags, when a release candidate passes CI, it can be tagged as a release if it is feature complete.

fields.description:
* Upon Story/Bug completion, update reports.
 * Webhooks on github can be used to trigger updates in confluence, to generate new data for reports.
 * Consider issues related to de-syncing if updates are lost.  Git commits are easily tracked via hashes.
 ** If we only use the hook as a trigger, and pull our own data since last update, it seems manageable.

fields.description:
Identity Linking:  Identify technologies used to authenticate to Linux Foundation IT infrastructure.  Use this as basis for creating identity passthrough. 
 * LFIT uses AUTH0 federation, so this should be easy.  
 * Jira supports linked github accounts, so if user behavior has already created a one to one mapping, there is much less work to do here.  If not, we still need to create a map.
 * Create a shadow profile for users that exist only in one location, for reporting purposes.  primary key off email addresses.  Use gpg id if commits are cryptographically signed.
 * (Github via simple proxy will tend to squash identities to the passthrough user, even if commit data is preserved.  We’ll have to create a map of github user identities and LFIT ids, to line up data. It might be possible to pass this through via commit data, or other. (Email address are and gpg signatures are often in commits)
 * Confluence will contain user dashboards, that reflect work done in Jira and 
 * Split this into subtasks.

fields.description:
Services will be managed with orchestration tools. (puppet/ansible/saltstack, etc)
 * Base OS Template  – Determine common os flavor preference.

 * Packages /requirements template
 ** OS Template
 ** pacckages/requirements.txt
 * Services
 ** To the extent possible package services as lambda functions.  Operate as server-less as possible..
 * Unit tests for orchestration tools.
 ** Determine where to run unit tests of orchestration, do we need just a jira/confluence sandbox, or a full instances to test against.

fields.description:
I will probably have to re-create this as a epic.

Meta project full two way sync of Jira and Confluence with Github, with REST APIs and security.  User Identities are preserved on both sides. Only public data will be synced. (Private and security related data will not be pushed by default).
